A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
This film is enjoyable\, but for me that's it. It felt like a long tv episode for some reason\, as if the action was taking place only during one long day. But other than that there were a few scenes of absolute brilliant directing that a wish had been present through out the whole film\, because they did stand out from the rest of a 'meh' movie.
Oh and about Mark Hamill's comments about this franchise\, I could not agree more.
Want I want to say is that I wish that there were more memorable movies made\, not money making products. The original Star Wars\, and even the prequels are movies that I can rewatch multiple times and still enjoy them\, but this is just something that I can only watch a couple of times at most.
I hope they bring back George Lucas's as an advisor and they substitute Kathleen Kennedy for someone else\, because boy are they distancing themselves from Star Wars.
